results.description:
Overview

Golf Resort Tycoon is a series of games in which players manage a golf resort. Cat Daddy Games developed the Golf Resort Tycoon games, along with other similar style tycoon games such as Ski Resort Tycoon.
results.name: Golf Resort Tycoon

results.description:
Overview

Codename: Kids Next Door is a series of games based on the cartoon show created by Tom Warburton. The franchise is about five kids whose objective is to fight crimes against children. The Kids Next Door are based in a high-tech tree house.

Characters from Codename: Kids Next Door are also featured in Cartoon Network Universe: Fusionfall and Cartoon Network: Punch Time Explosion.
results.name: Codename: Kids Next Door

results.description:
Overview

The two Dynamite Dan games are platformers that were developed by Rod Bowkett. Both games were published by Mirrorsoft.
results.name: Dynamite Dan

results.description:
Overview

Emergency room is a long running series of simulation games in which players are tasked with helping patients.
results.name: Emergency Room

results.description:
Overview

Mighty Hits is a series of light-gun shooters that were developed and published by Altron Corporation. The series only saw two entries in Mighty Hits and Mighty Hits Special. Both games were released in Europe and Japan only.

The first Mighty Hits game saw releases on both the Saturn and the PlayStation while the sequel only saw releases on the PlayStation.
results.name: Mighty Hits

results.description: A sub-series of the Dragon Slayer franchise.
results.name: Sorcerian

results.description: The third major part of the Dragon Slayer franchise.
results.name: Romancia

results.description:
Overview

The Gubble franchise is a series of games started on the PC as Pac-Man style maze games. The original Gubble has since been ported to the PlayStation and the iOS devices as an HD update.
results.name: Gubble

results.description: The "Air Conflicts" games are a series of flight combat games beginning with the original Air Conflicts in 2006.
results.name: Air Conflicts

results.description:
Overview

The Albert Odyssey series comprises of three fantasy RPGs. Albert Odyssey and Albert Odyssey 2: Jashin no Taidou are Super Famicom exclusives, and Albert Odyssey: Legend of Eldean is a Saturn exclusive. The first two games are strategy-focused and use a grid and animated cutaways for each individual fight, like Fire Emblem, while Legend of Eldean is a more traditional JRPG with turn-based battles.
results.name: Albert Odyssey

results.description:
Overview

True Golf Classics comprises of True Golf Classics: Waialae Country Club, True Golf Classics: Pebble Beach Golf Links, True Golf Classics: Wicked 18 and Waialae Country Club: True Golf Classics.

The first two games represent their eponymous real-life courses in virtual form, and were released for the Super Nintendo, Genesis and PC-9801.

The third game, Wicked 18 (also known as Devil's Course in Japan), does not represent a real-life course, but rather a fictional one with fantastical geography and unusual elements. It was released for the above three systems as well as the 3DO.

The fourth game is actually an enhanced version of the original, and was released on the N64.

T&E Soft were also responsible for the Harukanaru Augusta series of golf games, most of which were never released outside of Japan.
results.name: True Golf Classics

results.description:
Overview

The Fun Pak franchise is a series of compilations of classic board, card, and casino games. All of the games in the series were developed by Beam Software and published by Interplay in the US. In other countries the games have had other publishers.

Each game in the series contains multiple games, some of which had a running theme across them. For instance the Casino Fun Pak is a compilation of all casino game and the Solitaire Fun Pak is a compilation of all Solitaire variations.

All of the games in the series were released on the Game Boy or the Game Gear. Casino and Solitaire Fun Pak were released on both platforms.

The first game released in the series was 4-in-1 Fun Pak for the original Game Boy.
results.name: Fun Pak

results.description:
Overview

Nightmares from the Deep is a series of hidden object adventure games that are developed by Artifex Mundi. The games have a supernatural nautical theme, often including pirates.
results.name: Nightmares from the Deep

results.description:
Overview

The Pingu franchise is a series of video games based on the claymation animated children's television series of the same name.
results.name: Pingu

results.description:
Overview

The Vacation Quest games are a series of hidden object games developed by SpinTop Games and published by PopCap Games. The games were made available both digitally as well as a physical disc.
results.name: Vacation Quest

results.description:
Overview

The Escape franchise is a series of hidden object games developed by SpinTop Games and published by PopCap Games.
results.name: Escape

results.description:
Overview

Pump It Up, often abbreviated PIU, is a franchise of arcade, console and portable video games developed by Andamiro, a South Korean arcade game manufacturer.

The arcade dance games were representative of South Korean arcade scene from the late 90's to early 2000's, leading a huge boom of arcades - often referred to as the Renaissance of arcades in South Korea. After the popularity of arcades died down around the early 2000's, Pump It Up continued to be a success internationally, especially in Latin America.

Relationship with Dance Dance Revolution

In the beginning, there is no denying that PIU is a direct rip-off of DDR. It is objectively obvious that the dance pad is the inverse of DDR pad; instead of up-down-left-right pattern, the buttons are four diagonals and a center button. Simply put, PIU was simply yet another DDR clone in the sea of clones that were developed in the late 90's.

As the arcade games progressed - after yearly (or sometimes even more frequent) updates to the UI and songs, the gameplay also started to diverge from core DDR mechanics. For example:

  • Introduction of hold notes (before DDR)
  • Usage of USB sticks for tracking progress
  • Focus on high difficulty step charts as opposed to DDR's focus on accuracy.

List of Home Releases

TitlePlatformNotes
The Fusion - 1st & 2nd Dance FloorPCIncluded a PIU pad that connected to an adapter. The inputs to the adapter were ps/2 connection from a PIU pad and a ps/2 keyboard; the output was a ps/2 port into the PC. The adapter had a switch that allowed either the keyboard or the dance pad to be enabled - one at a time. The dance mat produced keyboard inputs, but reversed vertically (i.e., Q and E were mapped to bottom left and bottom right, S to center, Z and C to top left and top right) as a measure to prevent playing with a keyboard.
The Fusion - 3rd O.B.G. Dance FloorPCSold as both a bundle with dance mat, and also as a standalone disc.
The Fusion - Season Evolution O.B.G.PCSold as a standalone disc only.
The Fusion - Perfect CollectionPC
The Evolutionary Dance FloorPCInternational release; a USB dance mat was included. The game is most similar to Season Evolution O.B.G. with some Banya songs excluded.
Banya CollectionPCSecond international release.
The PREX 3PCKorea and International; last PC release.
EXCEEDPS2Korea; first console release.
EXCEED SEPS2, XBOXNorth America. DLCs were available on Xbox Live version.
EXCEED PortablePSPKorea.
Zero PortablePSPKorea. Last home version release.

Other Releases and Spin-Offs

  • Pump It Up Jump
    • Released internationally; a small cabinet designed for small children based on PRO software, using Stepmania-based engine.
  • Pump It Up Fitness
    • Shown at GSTAR 2013; never released.
results.name: Pump It Up

results.description:
Wildlife Park is a zoo/wildlife park management simulation franchise, that gives the player the potential to build and manage his/her own zoo, juggling animal happiness and fiscal success. The games include a variety of animals, spanning from farm animals to dinosaurs.

So far the series has seen 3 iterations, with 4 expansion packs being released for Wildlife Park 2, and 1 for Wildlife Park.
results.name: Wildlife Park
